intro: Sebaea humilis, commonly known as the dwarf sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has succulent leaves and stems, which help it retain water in its arid native habitat. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil. Sebaea humilis is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
